title: The One With The Tiny T-shirt

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Gunther is pouring Rachel coffee.]

dialogue.speaker: GUNTHER
dialogue.text: Here you go.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: GUNTHER
dialogue.text: (In his head) Say Rachel, I was wondering if you’d like to go to a movie with me sometime. As my lover! Nnnsch, to out there. Maybe you’d just like to ah, get something to eat with me sometime? As my lover.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: (entering) Hi!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi! All right, let’s go shoppin’!!

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Um, y'know, before we go ah, there’s something I need to say.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, okay.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: I’ve kinda of had this ah, this crush on you. (Rachel is shocked) But since you were with Ross, I-I didn’t do anything about it. But, now that you’re not, I’d really like to ask you out sometime. So-so that’s-that’s what I’m doing, now.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wow! Umm....

dialogue.speaker: GUNTHER
dialogue.text: I dropped a cup.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The hallway between the two apartments, Pete and Monica are returning from
their date.]

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: ...so y'know, that’s why, within a few years, that voice recognition is gonna be pretty much standard on any computer you buy. Y'know, so you could be like-like, ‘Wash my car.’ ‘Clean my room.’ It’s not gonna be able to do any of those things, but it’ll understand what you’re saying.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, this is so great.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Yeah, it was.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right then. (He leans in to kiss her goodnight, but she quickly kisses him on the cheek and pats his shoulder.) Bye.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hello, people who do not live here.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hi! Hello!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I gave you a key for emergencies!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: We were out of Doritos .

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, how’d the date go with Mr. Millionaire?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Mr. Millionaire, new from Snooty Playthings! Third wife sold separately.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: He’s great! I mean we have such a good time together! He’s so funny, and sooo sweet, and I’m not attracted to him at all!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Still?!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Noo!! It’s driving me crazy. I mean every other way he’s like the perfect guy, he has everything. Plus! He actually has everything.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Life-sized Imperial Storm Troopers from Sharper Image ?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Two.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Wow!! Can Joey and I put them on and fight?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (entering, dancing and singing) Oh mommie, oh daddie, I am a big old baddie! Oh mommie, oh daddie, I am a big old baddie! (He dances around the dinner table and exits)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I guess he musta gotten the part in that play.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA AND PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, either that, or Gloria Estefan was right, eventually, the rhythm is going to get you.

scenes.location: The hallway between the two apartments

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A Theatre, Joey is arriving to rehearse the play he’s in.]

dialogue.speaker: THE DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Joe. How’s it going?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Good. (He sets his stuff down and starts talking to Kate, another cast member.) Hey.

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, so you’re playing Adrienne, huh?

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Yes. Are you one of the retarded cousins?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, no. Ah, I playing your husband, Victor. I’m Joey Tribianni.

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Hi, nice to meet you. Kate Miller.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So the ah, play’s pretty great, huh?

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah. I love Jennifer Van Murray’s work. She’s so brilliantly incisive when it comes to deconstructing the psyche of the American middle class.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, forget about it. She rocks!

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Where do I know you from?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Dr. Drake Remoray. Days of Our Lives . Voted most datable neurosurgeon by Teen Beat .

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: No, that’s not it. So, you’re a soap actor? Well this must be pretty exciting for you to be in a real play, hmm?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, I’ve done plays before. I’m a serious actor.

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: That info-mercial! For the milk carton spout thing! You’re-you’re-you’re the guy that doesn’t know how to pour milk!!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: See, I actually can pour milk, but I got you believing that I couldn’t. Now, see, that’s acting.

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Right, at the end, you choked on a cookie.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, that was real.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is telling Phoebe about Mark, as Gunther eavesdrops behind
them.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wow! I cannot believe Mark asked you out.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I know.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What, so what are you gonna tell him?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, I told him I would think about it, but I’m gonna tell him no.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Huh.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I mean I think I’d say no to anybody right now. (Hearing this Gunther swoops back to cleaning tables.) Oh, but it was so strange. I mean I’m standing there with this charming, cute guy, who’s asking me to go out with him, which I’m allowed to do, and I felt guilty. Y'know, like I’d be cheating on Ross or something.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wow. So, okay, maybe that means that, you’re not over Ross yet and you have issues with your father.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don’t have any issues with my Father.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, so it’s probably just the Ross thing then.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is telling Chandler about Kate.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I hate this woman!! I hate her! She told everyone in the company about that info-mercial, and now they all keep asking me to open their drinks. Okay, and whenever I can’t do it, they’re all like-like laughing at me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering) Hello.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER AND JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So Rachel called. Wants to see me. Going over in a minute.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Wow, what-what do you think she wants?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, maybe the crazy fog has lifted and she realises that life without me.... a-sucks.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: It’s possible. You are very loveable, I’d miss you if I broke up with you. (Ross glares at him) I was just trying to be supportive.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Then be supportive like a guy.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (in a deep voice) If I broke up with you, I’d miss you.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is there as Ross enters, walking very confidently.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You ah, wanted to see me?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah. Ahh, here’s a box of your stuff. (hands him a box)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, y'know, it’s just like hats, and a shirt, and CD’s, just sort of stuff that you’ve left here.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What are you doing? Are you trying to hurt me? Or something?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No. Ross, it, it just seems that y'know it’s time we-we y'know, move on. I mean, I mean don’t’ you think?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes, I do.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Good.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, I-I really do. (takes a dinosaur mug out of the box) Hey! This-this was a gift?!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross, you got that for free from the museum gift shop.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It’s still a gift! I got it from the gift shop !

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, all right, give me the mug! I’ll keep the mug.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No!! Y'know-y'know don’t do me any favours. In fact, where, where’s the rest of my stuff?! Huh? Like-like my umm, (picks up a book) Hey, this book is mine!! And-and-and, and that T-shirt you sleep in? I’d like that back too. Yes, I do.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You know how much I love that T-shirt! You never even where that T-shirt!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I’m just trying to help you, move on.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, you are a petty man. You are a petty, petty....

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Petty...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Petty... (goes into her room)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Petty...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Petty...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Petty...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Small...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Small... (Rachel comes back into the living room and catches Ross mocking her.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You are so just doing this out of spite.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Awwwahuh, no, no, no!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Huh?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I’m-I’m gonna wear this all the time! I love this shirt!! (he kisses the shirt)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You have not worn that T-shirt since you were 15!! It doesn’t even fit you anymore!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah-yeah-yeah-yeah...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (imitating him) yeah-yeah-yeah!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh-oh, okay, okay! (He quickly takes off his sweater in order to put on the T-shirt. It’s an old ‘Frankie says relax’ T-shirt, that barely fits him. Rachel nods her head in approval of the new look.) If you don’t mind I’m gonna the rest of my stuff, and relax, in my favourite shirt. (Starts to leave) You have a pleasant evening. (He exits and leaves the door open.)

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, the gang minus Rachel and Ross are talking to Pete.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So, you’re like a zillionaire? (Pete smiles and nods)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And you’re our age. You’re our age.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Y'know what, you should like, you should buy a state and then just name it after yourself.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: What like Pete Dakota?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, or, or, or, Mississ-Pete.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, oh, I got it! Pete-Chicago.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That’s not a state Joe.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, and Mississ-Pete is?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: I got to go, so ah, I’ll see you guys later.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You’re our age!

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: (to Monica, by the door) So ah, we on for tomorrow?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Absolutely! (He goes to kiss her, but she stops him and rubs his head and says...) Now get out of here you!! (Pete leaves) (to the gang) Okay, I’m running out of places I can touch him! Look, is there something wrong with me? I mean why am I only attracted to guys where there’s no future? Either they’re too old, or they’re too young, and then there’s Pete who’s-who’s crazy about me, and who’s absolutely perfect for me, and there’s like zip going on! I mean, seriously, does it sound like something’s wrong with me?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, kinda.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Theatre, Joey and Kate are rehearsing for the play.]

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Happy?! Is that what I’m supposed to be Vic? Happy?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, why don’t you tell me what you’re supposed to be! Huh? Because I sure as hell can’t figure it out! I talk to you and nothin’. You look at me, and it’s nothin’. (He kisses her) Nothing.

dialogue.speaker: THE DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Tasty! I’m really starting to feel like you guys have a history, it’s-it’s nice.

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: I have a question about this scene.

dialogue.speaker: THE DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Yes?

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Well, I don’t understand why Adrienne’s attracted to Victor.

dialogue.speaker: THE DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Peel the onion. First of all, he’s good looking.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: I think my character’s gonna need a little bit more of reason than that.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, hey, how about this one. Ah, it’s says so in the script! Y'know ah, I-I don’t know why my character likes you either, I mean it says in the script here that you’re a bitch.

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: It doesn’t say that in the script.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: It does in mine!

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Hallway, Chandler and Ross are returning from working out.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I can blow dry it. I can put gel on it. It doesn’t matter, I still wind up with this little (pats the flat spot on the back of his head) cowlicky thing on the middle part of my head. It’s so annoying. Does it bug you?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You bug me.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Is there any chance you didn’t see that?

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is watching a basketball game, Ross is staring
out the peephole.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ross! You gotta stop! Okay?! You can’t just stare through the peep hole for three hours! You’re gonna get peep eye!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I knew it! I knew it! I always knew she liked him! Y'know, she’d say no, but here we are! Right? We just broke up, first thing she does!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You didn’t just break up.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, it’s been like three weeks!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You slept with somebody three hours after you thought you broke up. I mean bullets have left guns slower!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Here they come, here they come. Oh-ho, if she kisses him goodnight, I’m gonna kill myself, I swear. I can’t, I can’t watch this. (turns away, then quickly turns to look again) Come on, date over! Date over! Uh-oh, here we go, she’s going in.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: She’s going in. Wait! He’s going in! He’s going in!! The door’s closed! I, I can’t see anything but the door closed!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And the inventor of the door rests happily in his grave.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, I have to do something. I mean, I have, I have to stop it!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Stop what?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I don’t know, but I ah, I have the feeling that my being there will do it. I’ll go over and I will borrow something. Juice!! I need juice!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No!! You can’t!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, they must be stopped!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I am your friend, and I am not gonna let you do this!! (Ross is now dragging Chandler and the foosball table to the door) You are surprisingly strong!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I need juice! People need juice!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Look man!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: People need juice!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Listen to me!! (Chandler turns him around and closes and holds the door shut with his feet.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Juice, I need...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: She’s moving on! Okay, if it’s not this guy, it’s gonna be somebody else! And unless you’re thinking about subletting my peep hole, you are going to have to get used to the fact that the relationship is over! Okay, man? It’s over.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, okay.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It’s just I miss her so much.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I know. (He rubs Ross’s head)

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is pouring Mark some coffee.]

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Why do all you’re coffee mugs have numbers on the bottom?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh. That’s so Monica can keep track. That way if one on them is missing, she can be like, ‘Where’s number 27?!’

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Y'know what?

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: No. And I don’t think I’m gonna want to.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I can’t do this.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Yep. Yep, that’s what I didn’t want to know.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, oh, Mark, I’m doing this for the wrong reasons, y'know? I’m just doing it to get back at Ross. I’m sorry, it’s not very fair to you.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Ahh! Fair, schmair! Y'know? Look, if you want to get back at Ross, I am here for you. Really? No-no, I say-I say, I say we get back at him right on this couch. Right here!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh God. I’m sorry about this.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: That’s okay.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You sure?

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Yeah. I can just go home and get back at him by myself.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A Hospital Reception, Monica and Pete are there.]

dialogue.speaker: SPOKESWOMAN
dialogue.text: ...has become the penicillin of the twenty-first century. And so today, this hospital is about to take major steps toward leading that revolution. It is truly ironic, on one hand consider the size...

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: (to Monica) Hey, can I ask you something?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Sure.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Where are we?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (looks around) Well, with all these doctors and nurses, I’m gonna say, midget rodeo.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Just tell me the truth.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay. Umm, y'know, I don’t think, I don’t think I told you this, but umm, I just got out of a really serious relationship.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah. Wasn’t that like a year ago?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So I did tell you. Okay, y'know, that really isn’t the thing. Umm, the thing is that, right now I’m just in a place in my life where I need to focus on me. Y'know what I mean?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah. I know that.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I so wanna be attracted to you.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: But you’re not. Okay, good.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I’m sorry.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Y'know what, don’t be. This is not, don’t be, ‘cause it’s not so bad.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It’s not?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: I know I’m no John Bon Jovi, (Monica laughs) or someone who find attractive, I’m just, I think, y'know, that you might end up feeling differently.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, um, look I-I don’t want this to come our wrong, but ah, you seem awfully confident for a guy I just told I wasn’t attracted too.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Yeah, stupidly charming isn’t’ it? Well listen let’s, you wanna get something to eat? ‘Cause this place is kinda de pressing. (they start to leave)

dialogue.speaker: SPOKESWOMAN
dialogue.text: And the man who made all this possible... Mr. Peter Becker.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: (to Monica) One second.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is sitting in one of the black chairs, and turns
to face the other one.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I don’t think this town is big enough for both of us to relax in. (He blows on his hand) Draw!! (He quickly pulls the lever to raise the foot rest, like a gunfighter in a Western.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Joey) I wasn’t doing anything. (Joey starts angrily throwing his stuff down.) Uh-oh, what did she do now?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Just because she went to Yale drama, she thinks she’s like the greatest actress since, since, sliced bread!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ah, Sliced Bread, a wonderful Lady MacBeth.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: God, I just, I hate her! I hate her!! With her, ‘Oh, I’m so talented.’ and ‘Oh, I’m so pretty,’ and ‘Ooh, I smell so good.’

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I think somebody has a crush on somebody.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, Chandler, can we please stay focused on my problem here?! Y'know?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I’m talking about you. You big, big freak.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh. (realises) Ohh. Ohh, you’re out of your mind.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, you have nothing but talk about her for the last 48 hours! If you were in a school yard you’d be pulling her pigtails and pushing her down now!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah?! Then how come I keep thinking about her in all these sexual scenarios and stuff huh?!

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Theatre, Kate and Joey are rehearsing the same scene as before.]

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Happy?! Is that what I’m supposed to be Vic? Happy?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, why don’t you tell me what you’re supposed to be! Huh? Because I sure as hell can’t figure it out! I talk to you and it’s nothin’. You look at me, and nothin’. (He kisses her, more passionately this time) Nothing.

dialogue.speaker: THE DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: You guys make me fly! High! Okay, we’re gonna pick it up here, tomorrow.

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Well, that was ah...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Better?

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Yeah! Yeah, it was definitely an improvement. G’night.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ah, Kate?

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You ah, you forgot your shoes.

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: (she giggles) I’m probably gonna need those. Huh? (she giggles some more)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, listen you ah....

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Hmm?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: ...feel like getting a cup of coffee?

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Umm.

dialogue.speaker: THE DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: (leaning in) Kate?

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Yep.

dialogue.speaker: THE DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: You ready to go?

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: THE DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: (to Joey) Very nice. Very nice. (he walks away)

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: So umm, I’ll see you tomorrow, huh?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah sure, goodnight.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is in the kitchen chopping vegetables. Chandler and
Phoebe are sitting in the living room.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Chandler) Hey! (Chandler looks up, startled) Why isn’t it Spiderman? Y’know like Goldman, Silverman...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: ‘Cause it’s-it’s not his last name.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: It isn’t?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, it’s not like, like Phil Spiderman. He’s a spider, man. Y'know like ah, like Goldman is a last name, but there’s no Gold Man.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, okay. There should be Gold Man!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey, Rach, how was work?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, great. Although I did sit down where there wasn’t a chair.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: By the way, Ross dropped by a box of your stuff.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, well, I guess I had that one coming. I’m just gonna throw it out, it’s probably just a bunch of shampoo and... (she opens the box and stops)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Something wrong?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (She takes the T-shirt out of the box and holds it to her chest and take a deep breath.) No. Nothing. (She smiles and goes into her room.)

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Phoebe and Chandler are sitting in the black chairs.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So, ahh, what kind of powers would Gold Man have?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay well, he would turn things to gold.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What about things that are already gold?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ahh, his work is done.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, let’s play my game now.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay. All right you yellow-bellied-lilly-livered-DRAW!! (they both kick up the foot rests like an old fashioned gun fight.)
